clinical_study.brief_title: Digital Rehabilitation Environment Augmenting Medical System
clinical_study.official_title: Digital Rehabilitation Environment Augmenting Medical System

brief_summary.textblock: D.R.E.A.M.S. will assess an immersive digital reality-augmenting system in reducing the occurrence of cognitive, behavioral, and emotional consequences of critical illness and environmental exposures that are risk factors for the development of delirium.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of Digital Rehabilitation Environment Augmenting Medical System (D.R.E.A.M.S.) is to research the feasibility and clinical potential of an immersive digital reality-augmenting system in reducing the occurrence of cognitive, behavioral, and emotional consequences of critical illness (e.g. pain, anxiety and insomnia) and environmental exposures (noise & light) that are risk factors for the development of delirium, a common and devastating complication in the intensive care unit (ICU).

primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of anxiety measured by Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) questionnaire
primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before and after each intervention Up to 7 days
primary_outcome.description: The assessment is used to gauge the subject's level of anxiety and depression 0-7 = Normal 8-10 = Borderline abnormal (borderline case) 11-21 = Abnormal (case)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before and after each intervention up to 7 days
secondary_outcome.description: Defense and Veterans Pain Rating Scale (DVPRS) Likert Scale 0 - 10, with 10 = severe pain (as bad as it could be. nothing else matters)

secondary_outcome.measure: Amount of sedatives requested by subjects
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Entire ICU stay up to 7 days
secondary_outcome.description: Richmond Agitation-Sedation Scale (RASS)- Patients with a RASS of -3 or less should have their sedation decreased or modified in order to achieve a RASS of -2 to 0. Patients with a RASS of 2 to 4 are not sedated enough and should be assessed for pain, anxiety, or delirium. The underlying etiology of the agitation should be investigated and appropriately treated to achieve a RASS of -2 to 0.

Richards-Campbell Sleep Questionnaire (RCSQ) five-item, visual analogue scale was designed as an outcome measure for assessing the perception of sleep in critically ill patients. The scale evaluates perceptions of depth of sleep, sleep onset latency, number of awakenings, time spent awake, and overall sleep quality.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After each intervention up to 14 days
secondary_outcome.description: A qualitative assessment of the usability and efficacy of the system Likert Scale 1-5, with 5 = strongly disagree.

arm_group.description: Patients will undergo a technology based guided meditation and relaxation exercise through use of an application on a tablet or virtual reality headset.

intervention.intervention_name: Technology based guided meditation and relaxation
intervention.description: Subjects will be guided through a mediation and relaxation exercise on a tablet or virtual reality headset for up to an hour each day.

Exclusion Criteria: The study team will exclude patients if:
- Their anticipated ICU stay is less than one day
- Patient is intubated and cannot communicate.
- Age: < 18 years
- Patient with recent (within 6 months) neuro-vascular event, intra-cranial surgery, and/or acute neurological condition as primary ICU admission reason
- Baseline cognitive impairment (e.g., advanced dementia)
- Patients who are unable to wear or use the DREAMS equipment
